Class ec.ez.prim.Runner 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.ez.prim.Runner
public class Runner
extends Object
implements Runnable
Runs when it can, but never on empty. A thread services a queue of Runnables.

myLock
"protected" so subclass can wait on this in their own way

Queue's something for this Runnable's thread to do.

Called only by Thread.start().

waitForMore()
Called by run() when we're out of messages in the queue, or after the debug hook does its biz.

myLock 
 protected Object myLock
"protected" so subclass can wait on this in their own way

See Also:
waitForMore

Runner 
 public Runner(Object lock)
Makes a Runner

Runner 
 public Runner()

enqueue 
 public void enqueue(Runnable todo)
Queue's something for this Runnable's thread to do. May be called from any thead.

run 
 public void run()
Called only by Thread.start(). (XXX It's a modularity bug for this to be public.) Pulls Runnables off of the queue until there aren't any more, then waits until there's more to do.

waitForMore 
 protected void waitForMore() throws InterruptedException
Called by run() when we're out of messages in the queue, or after the debug hook does its biz. Must be called while myLock is held.

May be overridden in a subclass to wake up occasionally to do background things, like checking for finalizers. The implementation here simply wait()s on myLock.

stop 
 public void stop(Throwable t)
stop 
 public void stop()
